cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW along Cuba today, expected to enter the southeastern Gulf tonight, then turn northwest and approach the upper Texas–south-central Louisiana coast as a strengthening hurricane late Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (vicinity of Port Arthur / Sabine Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches in effect yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings in effect yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline, including Sabine–Neches waterway
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (with a chance of hurricane-force gusts) are possible at Beaumont late Wednesday night through Thursday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for life-threatening storm surge of at least 3–7 ft above ground level along the Sabine–Neches estuary and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated totals near 15 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Power outages, minor river flooding, and possible tornadoes in outer rainbands.
